name: Ortega Preston
description: Odds are that you’ve either seen this bike or one that looks a lot like it.

name: Elvira Rivers
description: The new Model E is a sturdy, elegant beach cruiser assembled and painted in the U.S.

name: Sheppard Riley
description: It took some time, but one of the most well known bike brands has embraced the fastest-growing bike category: e-bikes.

name: Smith Stewart
description: This affordable single-speed model from Aventon delivers simplicity and style that is tough to beat.

name: Garner Schmidt
description: There’s a lot to like about the Roadster. It’s discreet, lightweight, and makes getting around a big city or small town a breeze.

name: Joy Alston
description: This RadMini hits the trifecta of weird but lovable bike niches: It’s an electric folding fat bike.

name: Oconnor Cline
description: Drop below the $1,000 price level and e-bikes start to get sketchy. Most use lithium-ion battery technology

name: Newton Parsons
description: One of the most affordable e-bikes right now is RadPower’s RadMission 1, a city bike with commuter potential

name: Brennan Clemons
description: Aventon’s Level is a nearly fully loaded, Class 3 commuter that helps you get the most out of the e-bike experience for less.

name: Franks Beck
description: Our team of experienced testers spent many hours and miles using most these bikes for their intended purposes.

name: Eloise Duffy
description: Usually, the cheaper the bike, the cheaper the parts. But this doesn’t necessarily mean you’ll be riding around on a rattling tin can.

name: Taylor Hinton
description: Usually, the cheaper the bike, the cheaper the parts. But this doesn’t necessarily mean you’ll be riding around on a rattling tin can.
